docs.text: one of the more unusual and suggestively violent films ever made , " se7en " is just a few steps away from brilliance .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , those few steps away are only a few steps from a level of evil and depravity that few people want to discuss .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film received mixed reviews upon release , but there's an underlying sinister appeal and intrigue to this that many critics perhaps did not notice .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: at times it gets preachy about the horrors it seems to be criticizing , but the script and the ultimate pay-off are excellent .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the shocking conclusion is just as unpredictable as the endings of most films are predictable .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this piece of work is 100% intensity .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's uncomfortable to watch , yet compelling .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " i want not to look , yet i cannot turn away . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the story creeps along slowly and deliberately , crafted by visionary director david fincher .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he has experience in tantalizing his audience with information and visions , but not giving away too much too soon .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is the guy who directed the ominous " alien 3 " .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " se7en " is even more ominous because the threat is real .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's human and , while the script takes some artistic licence , the way in which the diabolical killer works here is actually realistic .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: that is , if a human being could be so intelligent , patient , wealthy , and disillusioned .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after the most bizarre opening credits i've ever seen ( refreshingly different in editing style and musical accompaniment ) , the initial character development takes place .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: morgan freeman stars as detective william somerset , a knowledgeable veteran who is ready to give up on his job and the sickness of society .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: brad pitt co-stars as detective david mills , the young hotshot who is brand new to this unnamed city and full of fury to catch the bad guys .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: these two fine actors give the film its human qualities ( along with the appealing gwyneth paltrow , who plays tracy , mills' wife ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , none of them stands out above the material .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: no disrespect intended , but two other actors could have played these parts and the film probably would have been about the same .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: an ironic note is that somerset has only a week ( or 7 , that's seven , days ) left on the force to train his young protege .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the title of the picture also refers to the 7 deadly sins , as chronicled by john milton in " paradise lost " --gluttony , greed , sloth , lust , pride , envy , & wrath .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: incidentally , i wrote the sins in order of how each victim was found .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's the last two sins that are the most intriguing and shocking , but i won't give that away .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as i said , this has a great ending and no one should spoil it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: anyway , the brilliant killer sets out to make a statement to the world that these sins will no longer be tolerated and he makes the " sinners " suffer for it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the two partners stumble over the corpse of a grotesquely obese man .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they learn that he was murdered--forced to eat himself to death .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the killer leaves small clues at this and other murders and , of course , somerset and mills are smart enough to stay with him all the way .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: if they didn't , it would be one short movie !
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the deliberate pace allows for craftsmanship of detail and story .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we see a lot of blood , but it's not especially violent .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the suggestion of what happens is far more disgusting than anything actually shown--like most of the violence in " pulp fiction " .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " se7en " is gory , graphic , and disturbing , but all the gore is post-death .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: still , if you tend to get queasy , don't eat food during this film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: kevin spacey plays john doe , the avenging angel who claims that he's the messenger who will right the wrongs with his teachings .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: like many crazy men , he has some fine ideas , but some sick ways of expressing himself .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: spacey doesn't appear until the final 30 minutes and also doesn't receive billing in the opening credits .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , it's his appearance that turns this film upside down and for that he should have gotten an oscar nomination .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a great villain manages to make you either root for him or feel compelled to listen to his ramblings regardless of whether you agree with him or not .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this character is so well written that it's hard to disagree when he says that what he is doing will be remembered by everyone .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: no serial killer has ever been so creative .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " se7en " is blatantly unsubtle with its messages about the horrors of the world and it's often a little too depressing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what it lacks in those areas , it makes up for with believable dialogue , top-notch screenwriting , unexpected twists , and realistic characters .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the technical aspects of the film are unobtrusive .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: fincher uses lighting , music , and editing quite well , but his story is always the thrust of the film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: fortunately , we don't find out what happens to mills and somerset after the closing credits ( which are run backwards up the screen ! ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's better to imagine what paths they will follow .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is not the kind of film you turn away from and quickly forget .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's got a sinister message and john doe is right about one thing--the evils of the world aren't going to cure themselves .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " se7en " raises some tough questions and it's intelligent enough to allow its audience to answer many of those questions for themselves .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: useless trivia--co-stars in 1995's " se7en " , brad pitt and kevin spacey also competed for the 1995 best supporting actor oscar--pitt in " 12 monkeys " , spacey in " the usual suspects " ( for which he won ) .
docs.label: positive
